docs.snippet: There are many ways, besides the well-known sampling error, to get things wrong in polling....
docs.lead_paragraph: There are many ways, besides the well-known sampling error, to get things wrong in polling.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; recent paper examining over 4,000 late-campaign public polls for state-level presidential, Senate and governor races between 1998 and 2014 finds historic margin of error is much higher than touted 3 percentage point standard; reasons cited include misconceptions about sampling subset; revelations mean even if one candidate ends up with as much as five-point lead in early November, they may not end up victor.

headline.main: When You Hear the Margin of Error Is Plus or Minus 3 Percent, Think 7 Instead
headline.print_headline: If a Poll’s Margin of Error Is Plus or Minus 3 Points, Think 7

byline.original: By DAVID ROTHSCHILD and SHARAD GOEL

docs.snippet: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana and Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia called for a more aggressive American response to the conflict, such as setting up zones in the country to protect civilians....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana and Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia called for a more aggressive American response to the conflict, such as setting up zones in the country to protect civilians.
docs.abstract: Tim Kaine and Mike Pence both come out in favor of instituting safe zones in northern Syria to protect civilians, in rare show of solidarity during vice-presidential debate.

headline.main: Syria Draws a Rare Source of Accord in Debate Between Kaine and Pence
headline.print_headline: Rare Accord for Kaine and Pence: A More Assertive U.S. Stand on Syria

docs.snippet: The forces influencing the U.S. presidential election favor Republican nominee Donald Trump to win the popular vote - but even proven prediction models face "the most difficult election by far to predict accurately," a political forecaster with a ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The forces influencing the U.S. presidential election favor Republican nominee Donald Trump to win the popular vote - but even proven prediction models face "the most difficult election by far to predict accurately," a political forecaster with a three-decade winning streak said on Wednesday.

headline.main: A Trump Loss Would 'Upset the Verdict of History': Allan Lichtman

docs.snippet: Reproductive rights still have to pass through the eye of a theological needle....
docs.lead_paragraph: Reproductive rights still have to pass through the eye of a theological needle.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by journalist Katha Pollitt credits vice-presidential candidates Mike Pence and Tim Kaine for making their positions on abortion clear during recent debate; laments continued influence of religion on debate; argues Kaine has more respect for women's choices and separation of church and state.

headline.main: Can Women Be Trusted on Abortion? Two Men Weigh In
